cluster_classes.class_description: Broad environmental systems and interconnected processes that provide the setting for butterfly life cycles and interactions.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Ecological community of organisms and their physical environment... make up the natural world.

members.entity_description: An ecological community of organisms and their physical environment, in which caterpillars and butterflies interact as pollinators, prey, and contributors to ecological balance.
Broad system of ecosystems and living processes of which butterfly life cycles are a part.

cluster_classes.class_description: The overall variety and variability of living organisms within an ecosystem, including species such as butterflies and their ecological interactions.

members.entity_description: Overall variety of species in the ecosystem to which butterflies contribute.

args.new_description: Ecological systems and their overarching context, including ecosystems, the natural world, and ecosystem-level biodiversity and variability to which butterflies contribute.
args.justification: Both classes represent high-level ecological system concepts (ecosystem, natural world, and ecosystem biodiversity) rather than distinct domains, so consolidating them into a single ecology/ecosystem context class removes unnecessary fragmentation.
The merged class sits clearly in the ecological systems domain, so assigning a shared Class_Group clarifies its role and connects it to related ecological schema elements.

executed_decisions.justification: Both classes represent high-level ecological system concepts (ecosystem, natural world, and ecosystem biodiversity) rather than distinct domains, so consolidating them into a single ecology/ecosystem context class removes unnecessary fragmentation.
The merged class sits clearly in the ecological systems domain, so assigning a shared Class_Group clarifies its role and connects it to related ecological schema elements.
